alert.note: Alert for Kinney (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 2:49PM CDT until August 30 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Kinney. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 246 PM CDT, Heavy rainfall from earlier this morning has produced an estimated 2 to 4 inches of rainfall across southeastern Kinney county. Runoff from earlier heavy rains combined with light rain through this afternoon will lead to arroyo and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brackettville, Spofford, Anacacho, Fort Clark Springs, Turkey Mountain and Laughlin AFB Aux Field. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
